title: This champ select update was the perfect time to give us 5 bans per team
body:
But nooooooo
Nothing can ever be done right can it?

we went from 54 champions released before season 1 to 128 before season 6. In 5 years that's an average of ~15 champs a year. That puts us at ~173 champs in 3 years but i'm not sure that linear extrapolation is a valid assessment in this case.

Thats because before season 1 we saw a champion every 2 weeks and around season 1/2 they drastically began to slow it down until we have what we have now.

Honestly though as much fun as it was getting a new champ every 2 weeks this is a much better release schedule and allows for more creativity and build up.

Wat

I agree to a point.

The counter-argument of not changing too much at once is a decent one. I think I saw a red post where they said they were considering moving it up to 4 each side, but they didn't want to further alienate people who hated the new select system, and they were afraid that it would be too many changes for some people to keep up with.

But I still want 5 bans per side pretty badly.

Had a discussion with a coworker about this last night. He was against it until I pointed out "even with 10 bans you'd still have 110 options to choose from". He then understood that more bans doesn't necessarily mean there would be no options left.

> [{quoted}](name=Nukronic,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EIbdzwVh,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-01-25T22:09:35.577+0000)

Another issue that's kind of understandable from both arguments' sides and one you have to sympathize with the pro scene for once.

In Support of More Than 6 Bans:
- 6 bans aren't enough to stop all of the broken-OPs currently running unchecked.
- 1st and 2nd pick actually got made kinda awful to get now that they don't get any votes.

Against Support:
- 10 bans might be too much, especially considering most players tend to pick a small pool of 5-10 champs for Ranked and practice them a lot.
- 1st and 2nd picks come back into being highly coveted.
- Pro scene would be drastically affected in a probably-bad way. Some teams might just take out one player's entire champ pool that he's really good with. Example: Say Faker loses LB, Zed, Yasuo, and 2 other mids he's good with. Well, now he has to make do with sub-par picks, making him perform sub-par overall.

I think I'd be OK with 10 bans if there are more than 6 "trending" (AKA: FotM) picks during the patch, but the pro scene seems to be really comfortable with 6 bans as well.
If a pro team just banned one of their opponent's entire pool then they are potentially crippling their other lanes because they now have almost zero control over those matchups.

> [{quoted}](name=Eevee Girl Alex,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EIbdzwVh,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2016-01-26T11:34:10.270+0000)
> - 10 bans might be too much, especially considering most players tend to pick a small pool of 5-10 champs for Ranked and practice them a lot.

Unless they forced themselves to only play the 5-10 most annoying/OP champions, it's not a problem. Besides, if they want to show they are truly skilled, they should learn to play a minimum of dozens of champions. Cheesing your way up the ranks isn't showing you're skilled.

> - Pro scene would be drastically affected in a probably-bad way. Some teams might just take out one player's entire champ pool that he's really good with. Example: Say Faker loses LB, Zed, Yasuo, and 2 other mids he's good with. Well, now he has to make do with sub-par picks, making him perform sub-par overall.

You can't honestly believe Faker can only play 5 champions at expert level. He randomly took Olaf mid one time and completely dominated.

Pro players are sufficient with many more champions than you realize. It's what makes them "pro." Their favored picks at any given time is only a matter of who are the strongest in the patch. They don't care about the champion's lore, what they look like, and so on. Even Bjergsen jumped on the mid Ezreal train when taking Runeglaive on him was a thing. Have you seen Bjergsen play Ezreal mid before and after that?

The LCS pros desire what's strongest for obvious reasons, but are otherwise not limited in who they can actually play. Adding in four more bans won't change much at all.

first and second pick have the advantage in that they have full choice on your teams comp. if you ignore their picks you have a much higher chance of losing.

We don't need more bans... Banning is supposed to be strategic... You know this is a strategy game right?
You ban based on what team comp you're going for rather than the "op champs" at the time. =.=

The issue comes up when there's so many champs though. I'm countered by immobile tanky champs that deal a lot of damage, so I'll have my team ban Illoai, Darius, and Tahm. Garen and Morde are still open so my bans didn't help me, and now they're picking Graves too because he's strong and I didn't ban him.

ok ok watch this, lets say we have 10 bans, the 10 best picks get banned, the 10 best picks that arent banned get picked everytime, same problem, people will want 15 bans, and so on so forth, we dont need more bans, we need balance

>
> ok ok watch this, lets say we have 10 bans, the 10 best picks get banned, the 10 best picks that arent banned get picked everytime, same problem, people will want 15 bans, and so on so forth, we dont need more bans, we need balance

Not really.  

1. There is not that much coordination in Solo Q, 10 Bans is 5 per team, 1 per player.  Everyone will ban their own counter or champs they personally hate.

2. In the Pro Scene, the ability to target ban players would force ALL pro-players to diversify alot more they would need to know a bare minimum of  7-8, opening up the and letting us see more variance in the e-sport.
oh, well i didnt know mundo, soraka, tahm, jax, rengar countered all the others becasue they are banned every single game
Yes, but the second string of top bans have more counter-play potential.

The Pro-Scene would benefit from 5 bans each side as well. If they chose to target ban a player it would leave them vulnerable to the samr in return or even possibly having one of their previously played team comps entirely banned.

Having more bans ADDS strategy to the game. It also forces players to try new comps and champs and not just go with whats broken in the meta on this patch.
Dear God though, it would take forever to get into a game with four more people that could potentially sit on their hands and let the ban timer run out without doing anything...

I don't know about 5 bans per team right now because that's a ton imo but I do think we need to add at least one more per side.... I think that once we get towards the end of the season though we will have a more balanced game and not so many op/broken champs which are taking all of the bans instead of strategically banning out champs that can destroy what type of team comp you wanna build.... THat is until the next big update or preseason when riot destroys everything we came to love...

It was the perfect time. 
There is no doubt Riot knows the Boards feelings towards bans, and given the new champ select I have no doubt they considered it. 
This means they came to the conclusion that the cons of having more bans outweighed the pros.
Or champion tabs
I would like to see more bans, but I think that the appropriate time to implement a change like that is actually at the start of a preseason, not right before a season actually starts.
Banning out a lane would be too easy with 5 bans and a first pick. It's not how many champions there are but how many champions there are in the current meta and how many meta champions in each lane.
They probably don't want to add in five bans per team because of what it would do to pro play.

I think 4 bans per team would even be enough. It's frustrating as hell when you try to take out the stupid champions only to find out that there's a whole arsenal of them waiting around the corner to mug you off. Regardless of whether or not you underestimate a champion, or merely forget about them, they always show up if you don't because you can't ban them out. Why? Too many OPs. Although another solution to this would be to wait for Riot to finish balancing champions. But come on. I'm not gonna be around in 500 years time...
They are working on a new client, maybe they'll bring more bans with that. If not at least bring a way to look up owned skins.

You mean skins your friends own? You can actually see what skins they don't own in the gifting section in the store (where you'd normally go to gift them). It used to not show what they owned a while back.

To the OP. I think 6 bans is plenty. You have 40 seconds to pick what you are looking to play (during this time you see what kind of team comp you will be working with). Not to mention another 35 seconds for each pick. You want to ban the champs that would be more disruptive to your team comp you are showing. Rather then just ban champs that are annoying, and if they pick 1 or possibly 2 of those "annoying" champs, then you have to adjust your team comp a little bit. 


Some champs are a pain to play against, but you need to learn to deal with them, because if you keep using the excuse that they are annoying where will it end. Will 10 bans not be enough, will we need to just keep banning champions until the game has 10 champs left to play.

I know sometimes you have your heart set on playing a specific champ, but sometimes you have to alter because it doesn't fit in the team comp you have, or what kind of role you need to fill in order to give your team the best chance of winning.

Any way... good luck out there.

Tbh 6 bans is fine, _if_  people know how to ban. Whenever people just ban what shit on them last game and leave stuff like Graves open and he gets first picked, thats not the ban systems fault, thats people being selfish and incompetent.
